Abstract: Fritz Israel, 74, who was German soldier in World War II, recalls the war and how he learned about Holocaust, while Bernd Matzner, a 27-year-old who grew up in East Germany, reflects on country's unification and future; chronology of German history since 1919 (M)
Snippet: Fritz Israel, 74, who was German soldier in World War II, recalls the war and how he learned about Holocaust, while Bernd Matzner, a 27-year-old who grew up in East Germany, reflects on country's unification and future; chronology of German histor...
LeadParagraph: Fritz Israel and Bernd Matzner were witnesses to two of this century's most transforming events. Mr. Israel, 74, fought as a German soldier during World War II and grew up with the horror of Hitler and the Holocaust. Mr. Matzner, 27, grew up under communism in East Germany and watched in amazement when the Berlin Wall fell without bloodshed.

Headline.Main: 'The United States of Africa -- It May Yet Come.'
Headline.PrintHeadline: REFLECTIONS: GERMANY; 'The United States of Africa -- It May Yet Come.'
